intro: Borckhausenia capnoides, commonly known as the Cape fynbos, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a shrub-like appearance with narrow, leathery leaves. It is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat, with periods of drought tolerance. Borckhausenia capnoides plays an important ecological role in its native environment, supporting local pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
